narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: understanding reproductive rights and knowing how different identities affect women's reproductive rights
I learned how to analyze and understand methodologies of research in ethnography.
Learned about various issues related to women's health

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I CANT READ. This class was hard because it demanded a book a week, Although the books were good and <200 pgs I rarely ever got through the books. The strengths are that the books are all great choices and interesting reads. However I do wish the discussions were a little more guided and that disclaimers are made at the beginning of the class that we do not attack individuals and that this is a safe space. Due to the diversity in topics students very easily identify with different sessions making them very passionate and prone to feeling personally attacked when statements re rebuked. The class has a lot of heavy content, which is good, but we should have more rules about how we talk and respect one another.
Discussion could be a little lacking at times, but I think it could have been improved if the class had breaks in the middle.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes it's got a lot of useful knowledge. As a male mechanical engineering student I stamp this class with a seal of approval. Take this class and learn!

Absolutely!! Marcia is an amazing professor and has so much knowledge and empathy to sharethe class will be so interesting to you if you are interested in women's health, medicine in general, addiction, pregnancy, inequality, and more. If you really want to engage in the course, the workload is quite high (a book a week and a few papers) but the books are super interesting and not too difficult to read. Highly recommend
Yes, Marcia is a fantastic professor.
